Text.Text: Oh my...  Forgive me, noble one...  I know that I'm behind schedule... but not far behind...  We'll make up the time!  The work will be completed on schedule!
I'm repairing the floor here, and building a stair to the next level.
Well...  Yes.  I'm having some problems and falling behind.  I was hoping to deal with the situation on my own... but it has escalated beyond my abilities.
It's a bit of a tale.  Do you have the time for it?

When we first started work here, there was a lot of rubble and debris that needed to be cleared away.  It was hard work and took a lot of time.  Time that could be better used to make the needed repairs.  So, a wizard was contracted to summon a trio of elementals to help us.

It was wonderful.  The elementals would swallow whatever the wizard pointed at.  In a matter of days the worst of the debris was gone.  What little was left could easily be dealt with by the workers.  Before he left, the wizard bound the elementals here.  Just in case we needed them.  That's when the trouble began.

One of the workers, a woman named Vylu, claimed she was hearing voices in her head.  She said it was the elementals calling out to her, begging her for their freedom.  I didn't know what to think.  I figured maybe they frightened her, now that the wizard was gone, and that she was imagining things.

I decided to separate Vylu from the elementals.  I sent them to one of the rooms down the hall.  I figured if we needed to dispose of anything, we could just haul it down there.  It was a small price to pay if it helped her.

She vanished.  I spent every moment I could spare trying to find her, but I never did.  I finally gave her up for dead...  It was not long afterwards that she showed up again.  I turned around one day, and there she was.  She and the elementals were standing across the room, staring me down.

For the longest time, nothing.  Finally, she approached me and said that she was genasi.  That she was claiming the elementals as kin, and granting them their freedom.  Then she turned and walked away, the elementals in tow.

The problem is, I've had tools and supplies turn up missing.  Or I've set a piece of work down, turned away, and when I look back it's gone.  In every case I've found the missing items, days later, in the elemental room!  It's infuriating!

I... don't want Vylu hurt!  If I report her, they'll hunt her down and slay her.  She's not malicious, and she's never harmed anyone.  She's just pulled some annoying pranks.  Someone needs to convince her to stop this nonsense before the wrong people take notice...  Perhaps you could do this for me?
I would be indebted to you.  Please help Vylu.  You can find her down the hall just past the library.
Maybe...  What do you want to know?
There are four floors to the fortress.  Which one are you interested in?
The first floor is for visitors.  Sleeping chambers, a meeting room, a ballroom, and the office of some bureaucrat can be found there.
The second floor is for permanent residents.  Sleeping chambers, a library, a meeting room, and a temple can be found here.
The third floor is reserved for the masters of the keep, Isair and Madae.  Their throne room, sleeping chambers, dining room, and private sanctuary can be found there.

The fourth and final floor is for the defenders of the keep.  The barracks, infirmary, mess hall, and kitchen can be found there.  Access to the four towers of the keep can also be gained there, but I know little about them.
I know just as much about the Severed Hand as you do.  It's an old elven stronghold, and it was beat to hell in some war a long time ago.  That sums up my knowledge on the subject.

Well...  Priests, mages, and soldiers are what I see mostly.  You'll find the priests and mages on this floor, and the soldiers are on the fourth.  I've heard that there are other critters here, but I've never seen them.
We meet again.  How can I help you?
We meet again.  I know you refused to help me with Vylu, but I was hoping you would reconsider.
We meet again.  When we last spoke, you said you would consider helping Vylu.  Have you changed your mind?  Will you help her?
Well met.  Have you been able to help Vylu?
I have heard from Vylu, and she seems well.  I thank you for your kindness.
Hmm.  The strain of so many changes in her life, in such a short period of time, may have done her harm.  Perhaps her mind has failed her...  I would ask another task of you, if you would be so kind.
Please go to the infirmary on the fourth floor and speak with one of the priests there.  They may know of a cure for Vylu.  Will you do this for me?
I...  I am saddened by your news...  Please, let me get back to my work...
Well met.  It is good to see you again, but my work calls to me.  Farewell.
Then you need to talk to Jerre Stoh.  He can be found on the first floor.
Yes...  If there is labor to be done, then it is done by a slave.
The exit on the first floor is guarded by a demon.  None may pass by the beast and live.  The only other exit is to travel to one of the towers... and jump.  Either way, you're dead.
I... wouldn't know.  I have heard that the creature cannot be defeated.  At least not by any mortal means...
It was Jerre Stoh, the slave foreman.  He can be found downstairs.  Forgive me, but I should return to my work...
I've been told that a genasi is the offspring of an elemental... but I don't really know.
So I've been told... but I don't really know.
No?  Then... who are you?
I see...  Well met, then.  I am Roga Thulc, assistant slave foreman.  Ask me what you will.
Then... there is no way to help Vylu...
Calm down, I am not who you think I am.
Gather your wits about you, man.  I am not one of your masters.
You seem to be under quite a bit of stress.  Is it your work schedule?
Can you tell me about this place?
Very well.  Farewell.
Can you tell me what is going on?
Yes, please continue.
No, another time perhaps.  Farewell for now.
Go on.
How so?
What did you do?
So what happened?
What did she do?
I have never heard of a genasi.  Can you tell me what it is?
A genasi?  I believe that is the offspring of an elemental force and a normal parent, is it not?
A genasi?  I believe that is the offspring of an elemental and a normal parent, is it not?
A genasi?  I believe that is a child of one of the four elements of nature, is it not?
This is all very interesting, but I fail to see what the problem is.
Then why have you not reported this to anyone?
Very well, I shall do so.
I will think about it.  Farewell for now.
I cannot, I have other matters at hand.  Farewell.
I am sorry, Roga, but Vylu is dead.  She will trouble you no more.
Very well, farewell.
What is the function of each of the floors?
Can you tell me about the Severed Hand in general?
Perhaps you could tell me who or what I might run into here?
Never mind.  Can you tell me what you are doing here, Roga?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
Tell me of the first floor.
The second floor, if you could.
I want to know of the third floor.
What can you tell me about the fourth floor?
Can you tell me about the Severed Hand in general?
Perhaps you could tell me who or what I might run into here?
Never mind.  Can you tell me what you are doing here, Roga?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
The second floor, if you could.
Very well, what do you know about the third floor?
I am interested in what you know about the fourth floor?
Can you tell me about the Severed Hand in general?

Never mind.  Can you tell me what you are doing here, Roga?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.

Never mind.  Can you tell me what you are doing here, Roga?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
What are you doing here?
Can you tell me about this place?
When we last spoke, you were going to explain to me why you are falling behind schedule on the repairs.  Can you do so now?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
Very well, I shall do so.
I will think about it.  Farewell for now.
I cannot, I have other matters at hand.  Farewell.
Actually, I am here to ask you about the Severed Hand.  Can you help me?
I am sorry, Roga, but Vylu is dead.  She will trouble you no more.
Very well, I shall do so.
I will think about it.  Farewell for now.
I cannot, I have other matters at hand.  Farewell.
Actually, I am here to ask you about the Severed Hand.  Can you help me?
I am sorry, Roga, but Vylu is dead.  She will trouble you no more.
No, but I am working on it.  Farewell.
I have tried to speak with her, but she seems confused and incoherent.
I have yet to visit the infirmary to see if she can be helped.  However, I will do so.  Farewell.
I have a potion that may cure her illness.  I will deliver it to her.  Farewell.
Actually, I am here to ask you about the Severed Hand.  Can you help me?
I am sorry, Roga, but Vylu is dead.  She will trouble you no more.
I am sorry, Roga, but the priest in the infirmary is dead.
I am glad to have helped you.  Farewell.
What would you have of me?
I am certain that my travels will take me there.  I will see what I can do.  Farewell.
I will do it if it suits me.  Farewell for now.
I am sorry, Roga, but the priest in the infirmary is dead.
Actually, I am here to ask you about the Severed Hand.  Can you help me?
Farewell, Roga.
Actually, I am here to ask you about the Severed Hand.  Can you help me?
Farewell, Roga.
What are you doing here?
Can you tell me about this place?
Tell me, Roga.  Are all the workers here slaves?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
I see no guards here.  Why do you not escape?
What are you doing here?
Can you tell me about this place?
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
It should be a simple matter for me to deal with the demon.
Who told you this?
What are you doing here?
Can you tell me about this place?
I would like to speak with the foreman.
I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
This is all very interesting, but I fail to see what the problem is.
This is all very interesting, but I fail to see what the problem is.
I am a friend, and not here to harm you.
Someone with questions, and I expect answers.
What are you doing here?
Can you tell me about this place?
I would like to speak with the foreman.
Tell me, Roga.  Are all the workers here slaves?
Never mind.  I must take my leave of you.  Farewell.
No, I am afraid not.
